summary: This document is an email chain from December 2020 between defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim and MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center) staff regarding urgent requests to arrange video conference calls (VTCs) and legal calls with her client Ghislaine Maxwell, who is in quarantine. Sternheim cites voluminous discovery and upcoming filing deadlines, noting previous attempts have failed due to technical issues and facility limitations.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell, urgently requesting video and legal calls with her client due to voluminous discovery and filing deadlines.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Incarcerated client of Bobbi Sternheim, in quarantine at MDC, with legal visits cancelled and difficulty accessing video calls.

connections.description: Sternheim is legal counsel for Maxwell, actively working to arrange communication for case preparation.

events.title: Failed Video Call Attempt
events.description: A video call with Ghislaine Maxwell occurred but failed due to audio problems, conducted in a room between her isolation cell and day room.

events.title: MDC Response on VTC Availability
events.description: MDC staff inform Sternheim that there are no video teleconferences (VTCs) available on East SEW (likely a unit) and offer to arrange an hour-long call on Thursday.

events.title: Initial Request for Legal Contact
events.description: Sternheim initially requests daily legal calls and occasional VTCs for Maxwell, noting all in-person visits are cancelled due to quarantine.

locations: East SEW (likely a unit within MDC)
Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim (19th Street office, closed remotely)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's attorney, Bobbi Sternheim, was struggling to arrange reliable video or legal calls with Maxwell in December 2020 due to quarantine and facility limitations.
The case involved 'voluminous discovery,' with the latest production being 1.2 million documents, creating urgency for client contact ahead of filing deadlines.
MDC staff stated there were 'no VTCs on East SEW,' indicating technological or logistical constraints at the detention facility.
A prior video call attempt on August 18, 2020, failed due to audio problems, highlighting ongoing communication issues.
